You are a Dynamics 365 Finance implementation team lead.
A series of test plans need to be created and tracked during a company's development phase. Multiple users will be testing multiple aspects as code is released.
Issues and remediations to bugs will also need to be tracked.
You need to identify Microsoft solutions that offer these capabilities.
What should you use?

discussion.content:
Build hotfix in the development and accept change
Then, deploy it to the Production environment

Answer is wrong.
1. Download the Hotfix from LCS
2. Install the hotfix in Dev environment
3. Run build on the development instance and create deployable package.
4. Upload the software deployable package on asset library and schedule the deployment on PROD

Swap step 3 and 4 in the marked answer.

Seems correct to me.
Make sure that the application binary update package is applied to your dev/build environment AFTER it is applied to your sandbox and production environment - If the application binary package is applied on your dev/build environment and this raises the platform build version to be higher than your target sandbox or production environment, you will be blocked from applying any AOT packages that are produced from this dev/build environment. To apply AOT packages produced from a dev/build environment, your dev/build instance must be equal to or lower than your target environments.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/unified-operations/dev-itpro/migration-upgrade/install-metadata-hotfix-package

Based on official link. ShinjiHoang and Anjum are right.

I must say that checking in the hotfix as a pending change and schedule to pro before even building the hotfix in development environment is quite strange. Normal procedure is to download, install in development, build, resolve any errors, check in code.
On the answer area swipe 3rd and 4th option. Because deployment is the last option.
